context: I was recently talking with my dad on the phone. While we were talking I mentioned that I would be applying Round-up on areas of my sidewalks that had weeds growing out of control. He advised that was a bad idea with my kids and pets around and that I should use something else. He then went on to explain that he read about Round-up causing cancer. An hour later Facebook had numerous ads on my feed that talked about class action lawsuits for people that had been exposed to large amounts of Round-up and ended up with cancer. NO WAY WAS THIS COINCIDENTAL!

It would be highly restricted and regulated for license sale and use only, or banned entirely like Agent Orange.

If you look at the actual toxicity of Round Up vs something most people use every day like Caffeine youâ€™d find youâ€™d have to consume a thousand times less Caffeine than Round Up to kill yourself from either.

Use the Round Up, follow the directions on the label including that part that tells you donâ€™t drink it and youâ€™ll be just fine. Depending on the types of vegetation youâ€™re after nothing works better. The average person isnâ€™t out applying hundreds of gallons to thousands of acres where theyâ€™re spending the day soaked in it and breathing it non stop. If those same people were applying Caffeine at the same rate theyâ€™d be dead before the day was over, yet most people have no fear of Caffeine at all.

The Roundup lawsuit commercials have increased the hype with no science. Even the huge jury award a few years back, to agriculture workers that sprayed massive amounts of Roundup and other chemicals without proper protections, could never prove Roundup was the culprit in the cancer cases.
Small, household use, following directions, not spraying in windy conditions, and allowing it to dry has nearly zero risk.

context: Listening for the 'wake' word means every single word intercepted by the highly sensitive microphone is being processed by cloud servers of the parent company.  These words are not stored on your device.  Processing entails recording, cataloguing, classifying, archiving then responding as necessary.  These companies are not simply dumping your non-wake words and phrases into some data dustbin.  They're using every last word to define you as a commodity.

replies.context: Not true. These devices are listening locally for a limited number of wake words. ONLY after the wake word is detected do they begin streaming audio to their clouds for further processing. Without the wake word, nothing is going to a cloud.
Your reply could fertilize a field to a lush greenness.  The devices do not have the processing capacity to know the inflection or verbal nuance from every possible user for every possible wake word.

Back years ago, we used to communicate with our Russian relatives in the Russian language.  Just the regular family reports.  But, one time I set down and connected and I overheard a live conversation between a US federal agent and a translator, and they were discussing the exact phrasing of something that I had written in Russian. They were discussing it in English.  Evidently, it wasn't the exactly worded phrase, but was close to some sort of a code phrase that would mean something. So, they used to do it manually before they got the robots.   Be careful about talking about your childhood memories.  A bunny rabbit could be a nuclear missile to Siri.

context: As far as the "I didn't install that" part, you need to be careful when you install even legit things like the Adobe reader.
